page.title: 03Goring & Streatley Station
page.content: In 1887 the new Goring station was built.It only had two tracks and one platform.Just before the second world war started two more tracks,two more platforms and a footbridge across the railway were added.The station master has worked thirty five years for British Rail and has two assistants.About twenty three trains which stop at Goring on weekdays are going to Reading and twenty five to Didcot.On weekdays 384 trains(stopping and nonstopping)go through Goring but only thirty on Sundays.On weekdays 520 people go on trains to Reading and a hundred go to Didcot.If you buy a season ticket to London it costs 1255 pounds.Fifty years ago there was a coal yard with sidings leading into it at Goring and eighteen people worked there.
